question: 並
sourceMnemonic: The things that <kanji>line up</kanji> are the <vocabulary>ordinary</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>average</vocabulary> things. The extraordinary things skip the line, because they don't have to wait. Sad for all the ordinaries.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you to remember:

You're at the coast, looking out at the <reading>波</reading> (<ja>なみ</ja>), which are all very <vocabulary>ordinary</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>average</vocabulary>. Nothing exceptional about those waves.
